pyrex.signals.ARVZAskaryanSignal.RAC¶

static ARVZAskaryanSignal.RAC(time, energy)¶

Calculates R*A_C at the given time and energy.

The R*A_C value is the observation distance R (m) times the vector potential (V*s/m) at the Cherenkov angle.

Parameters:

time : float

Time (s) at which to calculate the R*A_C value.

energy : float

Energy (GeV) of the shower.
Returns:

float

The R*A_C value (V*s) at the given time.

Notes

Based on equation 16 of the ARVZ paper [R7373]. This parameterization is only described for electromagnetic showers, but in the absence of a different parameterization for hadronic showers this one is used for both cases.

References

[R7373](1, 2) J. Alvarez-Muniz et al, “Practical and accurate calculations of Askaryan radiation.” Physical Review D 84, 103003 (2011).
